title: Jane Seymour (actress)
summary: Jane Seymour OBE (born Joyce Penelope Wilhelmina Frankenberg; 15 February 1951) is a British-American actress, author and entrepreneur. After making her screen debut as an uncredited extra in the 1969 musical comedy Oh! What a Lovely War, Seymour quickly transitioned to leading roles in film and television, including a leading role in the television series The Onedin Line (1972-1973) and the role of psychic Bond girl Solitaire in the James Bond film Live and Let Die (1973).
